intro: Crotonogyne gabunensis, commonly known as Gabon croton, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its alternate, simple, and often hairy leaves. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are clustered in cyathia, a typical feature of the Euphorbiaceae family. Crotonogyne gabunensis is typically found in moist, tropical lowland forests.
